title: Weird MMR change

embed.description: Pandoval21 / Silver 3 34LP / 121W 133L Win Ratio 48% / Brand - 51W 52L Win Ratio 50%, Vel'Koz - 32W 20L Win Ratio 62%, Nocturne - 11W 15L Win Ratio 42%, Kennen - 11W 12L Win Ratio 48%, Pantheon - 4W 8L Win Ratio 33%

body:
Hey guys, I have been winning a lot of games recently, but my MMR is not improving. When my MMR was around 1150, I won 14/15 of the next games and then I had around 1300 MMR. I then lost one game and my MMR dropped to 1225. After around a 70% WR in the past 30 games, My MMR has gone down to 1150. During this time, I have ranked up from silver 5 0 lp to Silver 3 30 lp. I have lost approximately 70 MMR for each loss. I realize that OP.GG may not be correct, but I am still playing with bronze and low silvers. When I had 1300 MMR, I was playing with Silver 4 to Silver 2. I believe I am better than the other players I play with, but it is really hard to improve my rank when I gain so little LP per match because of my low MMR. My MMR was so screwed up that it took around 10 wins in a row to rank up from S5 to S4. I am worried that when new season starts and I do my placements, I will get like 7-3 and go to  
like bronze 3.       

Is there any way to gain more MMR, and is this issue normal?

replies.body:
I wouldn't read too much into what a third-party site lists your MMR at. Note that these sites can only **estimate your MMR**. The Riot API doesn't give them access to your true MMR, so your *estimated MMR* looks different on every third-party site you visit, depending on the algorithm they use.

Let me know if you have any questions.
how can we know what our real mmr is?

That information isn't public, so there's not currently a way to see your true MMR. 

Let me know if you have any other questions.

Thank you for answering my question, you da real mvp.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
